content:
We'll be having our first SMART ballot reconciliation call in 30min. @Kevin Shekleton @Isaac Vetter @Avinash Shanbhag @Jeff Danford @Grahame Grieve @Eric Haas @Corey Spears and others here: thanks for your interest.

https://join.freeconferencecall.com/fhir (meeting ID: FHIR)
We'll take notes in #smart, for those who want to follow along.

We'll be having our second SMART ballot reconciliation call at 3p ET today.

@Kevin Shekleton @Isaac Vetter @Avinash Shanbhag @Jeff Danford @Grahame Grieve @Eric Haas @Corey Spears and others here: thanks for your interest.

  • Meeting at: https://join.freeconferencecall.com/fhir (meeting ID: FHIR)
  • Live notes at #smart
(Sorry for saying "in 30min" instead of "at 3p ET" -- corrected above, and noting here.)
@Dan Gottlieb @Nikolai Schwertner @Pascal Pfiffner as well!
HI All

Sorry, hit send sooner.. i had a question on Token Revocation. I dont see anything in the SMART IG discussing process or standard for refresh token revocation. I came across RFC 7009 that talks about it. I am wondering if this is something that has/need to be considered to be added to the standard?
should ask on the SMART stream

http://www.hl7.org/fhir/smart-app-launch/capability-statement/ revocation is a manual process. The "manage" endpoint discussed on the link above allows the patient to revoke a refresh token/authorization.
That page links to the slides that discussed this proposal as well, which may be useful
In the provider use case, we likely wouldn't provide that link, becuase it's not the provider that authorizes or manages app access to the system - an admin usually does that
@Avinash Shanbhag it probably matters which use case you're wondering about, but in either case, it would be hard to dictate the process for revocation itself.
The manage link is nice b/c it allows that process itself to be driven by each implementation, but there's a UI available for the patient to do this.

We'll be having our second SMART ballot reconciliation call at 3p ET today.

@Kevin Shekleton @Isaac Vetter @Avinash Shanbhag @Jeff Danford @Grahame Grieve @Eric Haas @Corey Spears @Pascal Pfiffner @Dan Gottlieb @Nikolai Schwertner and others here: thanks for your interest.

  • Meeting at: https://join.freeconferencecall.com/fhir (meeting ID: FHIR)
  • Live notes at #smart
It's our third call actually :P

I was looking at the ballot spreadsheet and could not for the life of me figure out if this made it to the list.

Although revocation is a manual process the spec (if I am looking in the right place does support the use of dynamic client registration. Wouldn't in be reasonable to extend that statement to include RFC 7009 for an out of the box solution ...text I'm referring to ": EHR implementers to consider the OAuth 2.0 Dynamic Client Registration Protocol for an out-of-the-box solution "
@Debbie Bucci This doc lists all submitted issues. Did you submit a ballot comment that you don't see there?

We'll be having our weekly SMART ballot reconciliation call in 20min, at 3p ET today.

@Kevin Shekleton @Isaac Vetter @Avinash Shanbhag @Jeff Danford @Grahame Grieve @Eric Haas @Corey Spears @Pascal Pfiffner @Dan Gottlieb @Nikolai Schwertner @Debbie Bucci @Robert Scanlon @Dylan Mahalingam @Joshua Bell and others here: thanks for your interest.

  • Meeting at: https://join.freeconferencecall.com/fhir (meeting ID: FHIR)
  • Live notes at #smart
Also @Keith Boone is able to join, so we'll focus today's call on the SMART "Capability Sets" theme. That is: how should we break conformance down into meaningful packages.

We'll be having our SMART ballot reconciliation call in 4 hours, at 3p ET today.

@Kevin Shekleton @Isaac Vetter @Avinash Shanbhag @Jeff Danford @Grahame Grieve @Eric Haas @Corey Spears @Pascal Pfiffner @Dan Gottlieb @Nikolai Schwertner @Debbie Bucci @Robert Scanlon @Dylan Mahalingam @Joshua Bell and others here: thanks for your interest.

  • Meeting at: https://join.freeconferencecall.com/fhir (meeting ID: FHIR)
  • Live notes at #smart

Please note that we will not have our SMART ballot reconciliation call tomorrow. I have a conflict, alas.

@Kevin Shekleton @Isaac Vetter @Avinash Shanbhag @Jeff Danford @Grahame Grieve @Eric Haas @Corey Spears @Pascal Pfiffner @Dan Gottlieb @Nikolai Schwertner @Debbie Bucci @Robert Scanlon @Dylan Mahalingam @Joshua Bell

Please note that we will conduct our SMART ballot reconciliation call tomorrow at 3p ET.

@Kevin Shekleton @Isaac Vetter @Avinash Shanbhag @Jeff Danford @Grahame Grieve @Eric Haas @Corey Spears @Pascal Pfiffner @Dan Gottlieb @Nikolai Schwertner @Debbie Bucci @Robert Scanlon @Dylan Mahalingam @Joshua Bell and anyone else interested: we'd love to have you if you're able to join.

Given the holiday, we will not be having our SMART ballot reconciliation call this week or next. Looking forward to wrapping up the last few issues in early January!

@Kevin Shekleton @Isaac Vetter @Avinash Shanbhag @Jeff Danford @Grahame Grieve @Eric Haas @Corey Spears @Pascal Pfiffner @Dan Gottlieb @Nikolai Schwertner @Debbie Bucci @Robert Scanlon @Dylan Mahalingam @Joshua Bell and others here FYI.
is there a document with reconciliation decisions applied? Have we made any substantiative changes?

There's a doc of decisions we've made, but they're not applied yet. @Eric Haas is just getting started with this process at https://github.com/hl7/smart-app-launch/issues (full details in this spreadsheet).

A snowstorm in Boston has thrown off my schedule today -- as such, we will not be having our SMART ballot reconciliation call this week, but I have sent out an e-mail notice about a 2nd block vote. Please review and let me know if you'd like to pull any issues before next Thursday.

  • Total issues proposed for block: 11
  • Complete listing: this spreadsheet

@Kevin Shekleton @Isaac Vetter @Avinash Shanbhag @Jeff Danford @Grahame Grieve @Eric Haas @Corey Spears @Pascal Pfiffner @Dan Gottlieb @Nikolai Schwertner @Debbie Bucci @Robert Scanlon @Dylan Mahalingam @Joshua Bell and others here FYI.
